Summary: "An executor sold his mother's house, pocketed the proceeds, and ignored his niece and nephew for three years — until a judge threatened prison."

Summary: "A domestic partner waited years for an executor who refused to act, respond, or cooperate."

Summary: The estate looked simple on paper. It wasn't. But the executor didn't cut corners — and that made all the difference.

Summary: A woman's partner died and left everything to her. His brother was executor — and refused to act.

Summary: "When homemade wills were discovered years after their parents died, one brother became executor of both estates. What followed was more than a decade of delays, disputes, and a court battle that tore the family apart."

Summary: "A husband died and left everything to his wife. But by then, she had dementia — and couldn't act as executor. Their son had to ask the court to step in."

Summary: A mother and grandfather were trusted to hold an inheritance for two young women. They spent every penny.

Summary: Her sons helped write her will. They also witnessed it. The court declared the entire document invalid.

Summary: "A government body was appointed to protect Margaret's finances. Instead, fees slowly consumed her estate while her family watched helplessly."

Summary: "Four kids from two marriages, a family home, and decades of accumulated tension. This estate had every ingredient for disaster. Instead, it settled in five months with zero disputes."

Summary: "Named as executor because he was the eldest son, Michael realised he was the wrong person for the job. What he did next saved his family."

Summary: A DIY will kit from eBay excluded two daughters — but the court refused to accept it.

Title: Conflict - The Excavator and the Auction
Summary: Two brothers flew across Australia to demolish their mother's house the day before it sold — just to spite their sister.

Summary: "A daughter was appointed executor of her mother's estate. Three and a half years later, nothing had been done — and the court removed her."

Title: Transparency - She Kept Everyone Informed
Summary: "When their father died, three adult children faced the task of winding up a complicated estate. The eldest sister was executor — and she got it right."
